you for a knit on the terrace if you re a rabid love island uk viewer you might recognize the stripes on my original sample from the pillows on the terrace… no just me the brim is knit in 1x1 rib with 2-color horizontal pencil striping you begin by bringing your stripe floats up the front of your work to ensure they are hidden when the brim is folded a plain knit round encourages the brim to fold neatly after which striped 1x1 rib is continued so that the hat fits snugly to your head the vertical stripes are a simple and intuitive colorwork repeat where catching floats is unnecessary instructions for crown decreases are written and charted decreases are carefully spaced to ensure that the stripes remain vertical weave in your ends block and rock 🤘😎🤘 your new hat note i have knit samples with 2 and 4 colors i reference color a and color b throughout the pattern if you are knitting a 4 color version you ll break your yarn after completing all of the ribbing and assign a new color a and color b for the crown portion of the project if you re knitting a 2 color version your color a and color b will remain the same throughout the project sample 1 4 colors sample 2 2 colors brim color a is jet color b is brim and crown color a is navy natural color b is soft heather crown color a is living coral color b is rose cloud i held my yarn so that the lighter color in each sample was dominant brim with brim color a on size 3 3 25mm needles cast on 120 stitches using a german twisted cast on do not break color a but drop the yarn to the front of your work attach brim color b as if you were joining in the round knit the first stitch you cast on and work in 1x1 rib until you reach the end of your cast on stitches place a bor marker and join in the round from now on
